trans-unit.source: Premium Data is active. Thank you.

trans-unit.source:
Activate All Features

Step 1 - Obtain a 51Degrees on premise license key.


Step 2 - Paste your license key into the text box below and then select "Activate" to use the license key with this site.
trans-unit.target:
Activate All Features

Step 1 - Obtain a 51Degrees on premise license key.

trans-unit.source:
The fiftyOne/detection element of the config file '{1}' could not be inserted. Please ensure the following text is present between the fiftyOne tags and try activating the license key again.


<detection binaryFilePath="~/App_Data/51Degrees-Premium.dat"/>
trans-unit.target:

trans-unit.source: The device data file '{1}' could not be saved. Check the user '{2}' has write access to the folder, or change the folder location to one with write access.
trans-unit.target: The device data file '{1}' could not be saved. Check the user '{2}' has write access to the folder, or change the folder location to one with write access.

trans-unit.source: The license file '{1}' could not be written to this site's bin folder '{2}'. Create a text file with the extension .lic and paste the license key into the file. Save the text file in the bin folder.
trans-unit.target: The license file '{1}' could not be written to this site's bin folder '{2}'. Create a text file with the extension .lic and paste the license key into the file. Save the text file in the bin folder.

trans-unit.source: Whoops. There was a problem activating the license key. We're unsure why the license key provided could not be activated. Please Contact Us providing details of your site implementation and we'll try and help you.
trans-unit.target: Whoops. There was a problem activating the license key. We're unsure why the license key provided could not be activated. Please Contact Us providing details of your site implementation and we'll try and help you.

trans-unit.source:
We were unable to reach the 51Degrees.mobi license validation site at the host '{1}'. This could be for one of the following reasons.

  • This site is running in medium trust mode and the originUrl attribute in the web.config does not allow access to the host '{1}'. Change the originUrl to include '{1}'. Multiple host names can be separated by | signs.
  • The web servers firewall or another firewall is blocking access to the host or the SSL port 443. Check the firewall configuration.

When you've completed these checks try activating the license key again.
trans-unit.target:
We were unable to reach the 51Degrees.mobi license validation site at the host '{1}'. This could be for one of the following reasons.

  • This site is running in medium trust mode and the originUrl attribute in the web.config does not allow access to the host '{1}'. Change the originUrl to include '{1}'. Multiple host names can be separated by | signs.
  • The web servers firewall or another firewall is blocking access to the host or the SSL port 443. Check the firewall configuration.

When you've completed these checks try activating the license key again.

trans-unit.source: Check this box to automatically update the device data file. When enabled the site will check 51Degrees for new versions of the device data file and automatically apply them without recycling the application domain. Enhanced data is needed to support this option.
trans-unit.target: Check this box to automatically update the device data file. When enabled the site will check 51Degrees for new versions of the device data file and automatically apply them without recycling the application domain. Enhanced data is needed to support this option.

trans-unit.source: Check this box to enable device detection.
trans-unit.target: Check this box to enable device detection.

trans-unit.source: Check this box to share usage data with 51Degrees.
trans-unit.target: Check this box to share usage data with 51Degrees.

trans-unit.source:
The device data set being used for device detection does not include sufficient information about web enabled devices to support the device explorer tab.

Devices available in the enhanced versions of device detection can be explored on the 51Degrees site.
trans-unit.target:

trans-unit.source: The number of combinations of device, operating system and web browsers this site can detect.
trans-unit.target: The number of combinations of device, operating system and web browsers this site can detect.

trans-unit.target: The number of different web enabled device models this site can currently detect.

trans-unit.source: Either Lite, Premium or Enterprise depending on the active 51Degrees data set. Lite is provided with DNN Platform and Premium data comes with DNN Evoq. DNN Platform can be upgraded with a licence key.
trans-unit.target: Either Lite, Premium or Enterprise depending on the active 51Degrees data set. Lite is provided with DNN Platform and Premium data comes with DNN Evoq. DNN Platform can be upgraded with a licence key.

trans-unit.target: The version format of the device data file.

trans-unit.target: When device detection is used with Evoq or enhanced 51Degrees device data this option checks for a new version of device data at 51Degrees.

trans-unit.source: Upload a 51Degrees data file for use with device detection. New data files can be obtained directly from 51Degrees.
trans-unit.target: Upload a 51Degrees data file for use with device detection. New data files can be obtained directly from 51Degrees.

trans-unit.source:
Client side responsive web design (RWD) involves sending all content to the browser and letting the browser resize and adjust for the device. The 51Degrees Client Capability Provider enables the option to control content server side including sending different images, navigation and content to different device types. This reduces page weight to mobile improving performance, presents an optimised user interface, ultimately enhancing the user's experience.

Over 85% of blue chip companies use device detection, including eCommerce, Media, AdTech, Finance and Travel sectors. Read more for case studies and ideas.

Read More
trans-unit.target:

This reduces page weight to mobile improving performance, presents an optimised user interface, ultimately enhancing the user's experience.

Over 85% of blue chip companies use device detection, including eCommerce, Media, AdTech, Finance and Travel sectors. Read more for case studies and ideas.

trans-unit.source: The device detection settings could not be changed. Check the 51Degrees.mobi.config file for modify permissions and recycle the application domain.
trans-unit.target: The device detection settings could not be changed. Check the 51Degrees.mobi.config file for modify permissions and recycle the application domain.

trans-unit.source: Device detection settings have been updated. Recycle the application domain for the changes to take effect.
trans-unit.target: Device detection settings have been updated. Recycle the application domain for the changes to take effect.

trans-unit.source: When image optimizer AND device detection are enabled DNN will not send images to devices that are too large for their screens to display. Query string parameters can be added to image URLs to automatically size images to improve performance.
trans-unit.target: When image optimizer AND device detection are enabled DNN will not send images to devices that are too large for their screens to display. Query string parameters can be added to image URLs to automatically size images to improve performance.

trans-unit.source: The type of data management method in use. Stream uses less memory but is slower. Memory is faster but uses more memory.
trans-unit.target: The type of data management method in use. Stream uses less memory but is slower. Memory is faster but uses more memory.

trans-unit.source: The bulk of the device data is retained on the file system. Small portions are loaded into memory when needed. Reduces memory consumption. When disabled memory mode is used where the device data file is loaded into memory. File mode uses the least amount of memory.
trans-unit.target: The bulk of the device data is retained on the file system. Small portions are loaded into memory when needed. Reduces memory consumption. When disabled memory mode is used where the device data file is loaded into memory. File mode uses the least amount of memory.

trans-unit.source:
Image Optimisation

Ensure precisely sized images are sent to web pages by adding querystring parameters to image URLs to return precisely sized images for the screen. For example; <img src="Empty.gif" data-src="/image.png?w=auto"/> or /DesktopModules/Admin/FiftyOneClientCapabilityProvider/Images/Optimization.png?w=300

Images larger than the device screen will automatically be shrunk before sending.

Device Detection

For Web Administrators

  • Retain desktop optimized content such as Flash or big screen videos on the same page as smartphone and tablet content.
  • Use hover mega menus to optimize rapid navigation for mouse and keyboard whilst using a responsive menu for touch screens.
  • Redirect users to optimized pages for Smartphones and Tablets.
  • Enhance Google Analytics with information about screen size and input methods.

For Developers

  • Turn page content on and off based on server side rules. For example; Request.Browser["IsTablet"] to understand if the requesting device is a tablet.
  • Access device capabilities from JavaScript with http://HOSTNAME/51Degrees.features.js
trans-unit.target:
Image Optimisation

Ensure precisely sized images are sent to web pages by adding querystring parameters to image URLs to return precisely sized images for the screen. For example; <img src="Empty.gif" data-src="/image.png?w=auto"/> or /DesktopModules/Admin/FiftyOneClientCapabilityProvider/Images/Optimization.png?w=300

Images larger than the device screen will automatically be shrunk before sending.

Device Detection

For Web Administrators

  • Retain desktop optimized content such as Flash or big screen videos on the same page as smartphone and tablet content.
  • Use hover mega menus to optimize rapid navigation for mouse and keyboard whilst using a responsive menu for touch screens.
  • Redirect users to optimized pages for Smartphones and Tablets.
  • Enhance Google Analytics with information about screen size and input methods.

For Developers

  • Turn page content on and off based on server side rules. For example; Request.Browser["IsTablet"] to understand if the requesting device is a tablet.
  • Access device capabilities from JavaScript with http://HOSTNAME/51Degrees.features.js
